bibl.title: Sahaja: the role of dohā & caryāgīti in the cultural Indo-Tibetan interface

sentence.phrase: Doha Treasure Song on Caṇḍalīkā
Homage to the Lady who fulfills all aspirations!
The fire of Caṇḍalīkā from within
Makes the nectar drop from the core
And the staff rise on its own.
Gone up to the mount of its peak it just stays
And makes the Natha's nectar drop.
Victory over long [endured] suffering of Samsara!
Freedom from the fear of falling [prey] to Yama!
The Mala of [all] Buddha's qualities emerges
[And] Great Bliss arises,
Spreading all over, all over.
Victory over long [endured] suffering of Samsara!
Freedom from the fear of falling [prey] to Yama!
The Vajra under control and protected
Waving burnt both, sun and moon,
Dissolves into the sphere of the sky.
Gone into the citadel of Great Bliss
The qualities of the central Buddha of all
Point towards the realm of Ratnasambhava.
Victory over long [endured] suffering of Samsara!
Freedom from the fear of falling [prey] to Yama!
By blocking the wind to cause outflow
Gone into the realm of clear Ratna,
Holding out, holding out, by this test
May I, Virūpa, get accomplished!
Victory over long [endured] suffering of Saṃsāra!
Freedom from the fear of falling [prey] to Yama!
Karmacaṇḍalīkā Dohākoṣagītī sang by the Acārya Virūpa.
